data:
Facsimile Images

[C(aio) Vallio ---] Quir(ina) Postum[o patro]no [mu]nicipii
[flam(ini) divi H]adriani perpetuo [in] quinq(ue) decur(ias) iudi-
[cum inter] quadringenarios adlecto a divo Anto-
[nino Au]g(usto) Pio omnib(us) honorib(us) civitatis suae ho-
5[nestissi]me functo item legatione gratuita apud
[divum] Hadrianum et apud amplissimum ordinem de
[vectig]alib(us) redhibendis pleps Gaulitana ex aere con-
[lato o]b plura merita eius ((❦)) d(ecreto) d(ecurionum) ((❦))

Apparatus criticus

Photographs and Pirino

English translation

To Caius Vallius Postumus [son ?], of tribe Quirina, patron of the municipium, perpetual flamen of Divus Hadrian, raised to the rank of quadringenarius amongst the five decuria of judges by the divine Antoninus Augustus Pius, having most honourably held all the honours of a citizen of his own town, as well as having at his own expense served as legate both to the deified Hadrian and the Senate regarding the repayment of taxes, the plebs Gaulita [set this up] by public subscription on account of his many merits and by decree of the decuriones

commentary

bibliography

    10.7507 & p.994 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589 2006.0518 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283 6772 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000352 Christol and Pirino 2006 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001367
